text: Kumail Nanjiani (born May 2, 1978) is a Pakistani-American actor, podcast host, stand-up comedian and writer. He is also known as the voice of Prismo on the Emmy Award-winning animated series Adventure Time. He starred on the TNT series Franklin & Bash and the Adult Swim series Newsreaders. In 2017, Nanjiani starred in the semi-autobiographical romantic comedy movie The Big Sick set in Chicago, which he wrote with his wife Emily V. Gordon. They were nominated for the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay at the 90th Academy Awards. ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Chicago Category:Actors from Karachi Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:American movie actors Category:American radio personalities Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American television writers Category:American voice actors Category:Comedians from Chicago Category:Comedians from New York (state) Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Screenwriters from Chicago Category:Screenwriters from New York (state) Category:Television personalities from Chicago Category:Television personalities from New York (state) Category:Writers from Karachi
title: Kumail Nanjiani
